subclusters.subcluster_name: Hormonal Imbalance and Immune Signaling Neuroendocrine Theory
Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
Neuroendocrine-Ovarian Interaction Theory of Reproductive Aging

theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chronic HPA axis activation, glucocorticoid-mediated damage, and stress hormone feedback disruption driving aging.
Describes glucocorticoid receptor loss in hippocampus and HPA axis hyperactivity causing neurodegeneration and cognitive decline.
Details age-related decline in corticosteroid secretion and receptor plasticity affecting neuroendocrine regulation and cognition.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Imbalance and Immune Signaling Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links age-related cortisol:DHEA imbalance to impaired immune PKC signaling via RACK1 regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Imbalance and Immune Signaling Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Connects decline in adrenal androgens (DHEA) to increased IL-6 and immunosenescence, linking endocrinosenescence to immune aging.
Emphasizes thymic involution driven by hypothalamic and neuroendocrine changes causing immune decline and systemic aging.
Describes integrated immune-neuroendocrine network with thymic hormone decline disrupting homeostasis and driving aging.
Focuses on aging-induced disruption of neuroendocrine feedback/feedforward loops and loss of hormone pulsatility and synchrony.
Describes hormone secretion alterations, hypophysectomy effects, and pituitary hormone roles in systemic aging regulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Pleiotropy and Trade-off Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Explains aging as a result of hormonal pleiotropy mediating trade-offs between reproduction, survival, and immune function.
Proposes aging as failure of integrated hormonal homeostasis and adaptation, with dysregulated feedback loops accelerating aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on age-related hormone declines causing aging phenotypes and potential reversal by hormone replacement therapy.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links decline in GH/IGF-1 and anabolic hormones plus increased cytokines to body composition changes and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes somatotropic axis (GH/IGF-1) decline causing cerebrovascular aging and systemic aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Shows GH receptor deficiency reduces inflammasome activation and immune senescence, linking somatotropic axis to inflammaging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Deficiency and Replacement Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Demonstrates pituitary hormone reduction (via food restriction or hypophysectomy) slows aging and extends lifespan.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Hormonal Imbalance and Immune Signaling Neuroendocrine Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes aging driven by insulin-GH axis imbalance and cumulative growth factor exposure promoting aging and disease.
Focuses on insulin/IGF-1 signaling pathway in neurons regulating lifespan and stress resistance across species.
Details conserved insulin/IGF-1 signaling in C. elegans regulating longevity via endocrine communication and nuclear factors.
Links reproductive diapause and juvenile hormone downregulation to slowed aging via insulin-like receptor signaling.
Describes endocrine signaling pathways involving nuclear hormone receptors regulating reproductive longevity in C. elegans.
Shows neuronal and endocrine gene downregulation affecting longevity via DAF-16/FOXO and sensory signaling in C. elegans.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Ovarian Interaction Theory of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on multifactorial neuroendocrine and ovarian interactions driving reproductive aging stages.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Ovarian Interaction Theory of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes hypothalamic-pituitary axis dysfunction and neurotransmitter changes impairing reproductive hormone cycles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Ovarian Interaction Theory of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes neuroendocrine timekeeping decline disrupting circadian and pulsatile hormone secretion in reproductive aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neuroendocrine-Ovarian Interaction Theory of Reproductive Aging
theory_assignments.reasoning: Links lifetime gonadal hormone exposure via HPG axis to frailty and late-life robustness differences.
Focuses on juvenile hormone's role in regulating senescence, reproduction, and environmental modulation of aging.
